item.title: RT Peter Boshard Olson: Clear explanation from @LangChainAI's @hwchase17: There are 4 main ways to give an AI app background info: 1. Instruction prom...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇPeter Boshard Olson
Clear explanation from @LangChainAI's @hwchase17:

There are 4 main ways to give an AI app background info:
1. Instruction prompting
2. Few-shot examples
3. RAG
4. Fine-tuning

It hadn't occurred to me that these are all ways of accomplishing the same broad goal. üßµ(1/2)

item.title: RT Harrison Chase: With Gemini's release, it's clear multimodality is here Thanks to @Saboo_Shubham_ for highlighting the great work @RLanceMartin did...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇHarrison Chase
With Gemini's release, it's clear multimodality is here

Thanks to @Saboo_Shubham_ for highlighting the great work @RLanceMartin did around creating a multimodal template!


Shubham Saboo:‚ÄÇMultimodal RAG templates by LangChain

Slide decks are powerhouse of knowledge, yet their visual elements are out of the reach for most of the RAG applications.

Enter Multi-modal LLMs like GPT-4V that can enable Q+A assistants to interact seamlessly with the visual content of‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1733002954720895228

item.title: RT Lance Martin: I've been testing a few different approaches for multi-modal RAG / QA over visual content w/ GPT-4V. I built an eval set on an invest...
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇLance Martin
I've been testing a few different approaches for multi-modal RAG / QA over visual content w/ GPT-4V. I built an eval set on an investor presentation (Q3 earnings from @datadoghq) as a test case. Results / learnings:

(1) Text loading: As a base-case, I loaded the slide deck w/ a‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1732862263026135197

item.description:
‚≠êÔ∏è Multi-modal RAG public benchmark ‚≠êÔ∏è

Multi-modal LLMs are one of the most important emerging trends for the coming year.

They promise to unlock new types of Q+A assistants over visual content, but multi-modal RAG architectures remain uncertain.

We are releasing a small‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1732839745112449142

item.title: RT Jacob Lee: ü§ñ Connery Actions Tool for Agents ü§ñ @connery_io is an OSS plugin infrastructure you can use with @LangChainAI JS/TS agents in 0.0....
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇJacob Lee
ü§ñ Connery Actions Tool for Agents ü§ñ

@connery_io is an OSS plugin infrastructure you can use with @LangChainAI JS/TS agents in 0.0.203!

Define a set of actions using integrations like Gmail, and let them handle auth + secret management.

s/o machulav!

https://js.langchain.com/docs/integrations/toolkits/connery

item.title: A good guide of different local LLM options - and LangChain supports all of them!
item.description:
A good guide of different local LLM options - and LangChain supports all of them!


Patrick Loeber:‚ÄÇWant to run LLMs locally on your Laptop?ü§ñüíª

Here's a quick overview of the 5 best frameworks to run LLMs locally:

1. Ollama
Ollama allows you to run LLMs locally through your command line and is probably the easiest framework to get started with.

Just use the installer or the‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1732769003565678915

item.title: RT Raouf Chebri üêò: Agreed. I wrote a few RAG pipelines from scratch and I wish I just used @LangChainAI.
item.description:
RT‚ÄÇRaouf Chebri üêò
Agreed.

I wrote a few RAG pipelines from scratch and I wish I just used @LangChainAI.


Stan Girard:‚ÄÇDon't use @LangChainAI, it is just a wrapper that adds complexity...

Is a lie! And here is why ?

Two days ago I removed my custom code on @quivr_brain to embed files and used @LangChainAI. Guess what ? It made embedding 50/100 times faster and reduce my cloud cost by 2.

You‚Ä¶ https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1732437384615068108
